question_content.barrons:question: Perry’s critics in the scientific world ________ that many of the observations he has made during more than a decade of research in Costa Rica have been reported as anecdotes in popular magazines rather than as carefully documented case studies in technical journals.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
charge; carp.

The critics charge (make the accusation) or carp (find fault; grumble) that Perry has published only anecdotes of his observations and has not published any detailed analyses. The key phrase here is rather than. It signals that there is a contrast between what Perry’s critics would have wanted him to publish ("carefully documented case studies in technical journals") and what he has actually published ("anecdotes in popular magazines").

Intimate is incorrect. To intimate is to hint or suggest. It makes no sense in the context.

Applaud is incorrect. The scientists are critical of Perry; they are not applauding that their colleague’s observations have been reported as anecdotes.

Theorize is incorrect. Perry’s critics are not theorizing (speculating; conjecturing) about a possibility; they are criticizing something that has gone on for over a decade.

Apologize is incorrect. The scientists are critical of Perry; they are not apologizing for their colleague.
